Pre-Game Insights: This will be the third successive T20I series where Hardik Pandya will be leading India.
Suryakumar Yadav has shown the world what he can do, but the opening combination is one area where India are still searching for answers.
Umran Malik and Shivam Mavi will have another opportunity to build on their performances against Sri Lanka.
Mitchell Santner will take over the captaincy from Tom Latham, who had led in the ODIs.
Apart from Lockie Ferguson, New Zealand's pace attack is also thin on experience.
Ben Lister could be in line for a debut for New Zealand.
Others: Ranchi is a bowl-first venue, with chasing teams winning 16 of the 25 T20 games hosted there.
India have won all three T20Is played in Ranchi so far, including one against New Zealand in November 2021.
In 2022, Mitchell Santner had his best year in T20Is with both bat and ball. In 18 matches, he scored 133 runs at a strike rate of 143.01, and picked up 23 wickets at an economy rate of 6.63.
